title: SAP Chief Bill McDermott Embarks on Health Care Mission After Losing His Eye
summary: SAP’s chief executive lost his eye after an accident in July. Now he wants his company to delve deeper into health care, following a tradition of tech leaders who have turned to their industry when, or after, experiencing health problems.

title: San Francisco Ballots Turn Up Anger Over the Technical Divide
summary: On Tuesday, voters will weigh in on propositions linked to the technology industry and rising housing costs, including one to restrict Airbnb’s home-sharing.

title: Media Earnings, Yellen’s Testimony and the Jobs Report
summary: This week, a pack of media companies will report earnings, the Federal Reserve chairwoman will testify about regulatory issues and the Labor Department will release the latest figures on hiring and unemployment.

title: BlackBerry Unveils an Android-Powered Phone With Security Features
summary: BlackBerry is introducing an Android-based phone called the PRIV that may play a role in determining if the company continues to make phones in the future.

title: Elon Musk Says Never Mind the Hiccups, Tesla Is on Track
summary: The electric car maker’s stock is down by a quarter and production and quality issues have made headlines, but the entrepreneurial chief conveys confidence.

title: Axel Springer Raises Outlook, Citing Strength of Ad Sales
summary: The German publishing and digital media group reported a 32 percent jump in operating profit for the third quarter, to $141 million.

title: Digital Transformation Going Mainstream in 2016, IDC Predicts
summary: The technology research firm IDC predicts the pace of digital transformation of business is going to accelerate and increasingly hit every industry.

summary: Several executives at the DealBook conference detailed the growing pains of corporate culture from Silicon Valley to Wall Street.

summary: The company, propelled by its enormous user base, said mobile advertising now accounts for 78 percent of ad revenue.

summary: The elite artist’s choice will reflect the industry’s larger debate over how fully to embrace the streaming format.

summary: Interest and investment in artificial intelligence is back with a vengeance in Silicon Valley, attracting companies such as Toyota to make big bets in the space.

summary: Flipkart worked with Google to create a new mobile website that was unveiled on Monday in a move to improve the mobile web experience and steer away from apps.

summary: The move indicates that the German carmaker will continue to invest in advanced technologies despite the burdens of its emissions cheating crisis.
